books.title: Paradise Lost
books.author: John Milton
books.summary: A dramatic imagining in blank verse of the rebellion of Satan against God, Satan’s overthrow, and the Fall of Man.

books.title: El Dorado
books.author: Baroness Orczy
books.summary: Two separate interests want to free the imprisoned Dauphin of France.

books.title: Elizabeth and Her German Garden
books.author: Elizabeth von Arnim
books.summary: The English wife of a German aristocrat recounts, through a series of diary entries, a year spent revitalizing the neglected garden of their estate.

books.title: Queen Victoria
books.author: Lytton Strachey
books.summary: A sardonic and generally unflattering biography of Victoria Alexandrina, Queen of England.

books.title: Treasure Island
books.author: Robert Louis Stevenson
books.summary: A young boy finds adventure on the high seas as he battles bloodthirsty pirates in search of a long-lost treasure.

books.title: Getting Married
books.author: George Bernard Shaw
books.summary: On the morning of a young couple’s wedding, concerns about what is to come inspire discussions about the institution of marriage.

books.title: Three Sisters
books.author: Anton Chekhov
books.summary: Three sisters long to escape their provincial town and return to Moscow.

books.title: Five Children and It
books.author: E. Nesbit
books.summary: Five children encounter an ancient magical creature who grants them wishes—all of which go comically wrong.

books.title: The History of Mr. Polly
books.author: H. G. Wells
books.summary: A middle-aged man in early Edwardian England finds himself despairing at his failed business and marriage, and takes a drastic step to escape—with unexpected results.

books.title: The Dark Other
books.author: Stanley G. Weinbaum
books.summary: A young woman seeks the reason behind her lover’s outbursts of cruelty.

books.title: Seven Pillars of Wisdom
books.author: T. E. Lawrence
books.summary: T. E. Lawrence’s memoir of leading the Arab revolt against the Ottoman empire during World War I.

books.title: The Lodger
books.author: Marie Belloc Lowndes
books.summary: A maid and butler take in a mysterious, eccentric gentleman lodger around the time of the Jack the Ripper murders.

books.title: The Story of My Experiments with Truth
books.author: Mahatma Gandhi
books.summary: Gandhi relates his life experiences from his birth in Gujarat in 1869 through the Indian National Congress of 1915.

books.title: The Servile State
books.author: Hilaire Belloc
books.summary: Hilaire Belloc’s thesis that the capitalist state breeds a collectivist theory which, in action, produces something utterly different from collectivism: the Servile State.

books.title: Victory Odes
books.author: Pindar
books.summary: A collection of lyric poems celebrating the triumphs of ancient Greek athletes in various sporting events.

books.title: Candide
books.author: Voltaire
books.summary: A witty satire that tells of the young Candide’s attempts to stay optimistic through a series of incredible hardships.

books.title: Islands of Space
books.author: John W. Campbell
books.summary: Four men become the first humans to travel to other galaxies.

books.title: Lord Arthur Savile’s Crime and Other Stories
books.author: Oscar Wilde
books.summary: A collection of Oscar Wilde’s short mysteries.

books.title: The Story of My Experiments with Truth
books.author: Mahatma Gandhi
books.summary: Gandhi relates his life experiences from his birth in Gujarat in 1869 through the Indian National Congress of 1915.

books.title: Roughing It
books.author: Mark Twain
books.summary: Mark Twain’s semiautobiographical account of his travel across the United States.
